title.narrative: 004 EDUCATION SYSTEM STRENGTHENING

description.narrative: By 2025, capacity of the Ethiopian General Education System strengthened in evidence-based, equity-focused and decentralized sector planning, policy implementation and monitoring results for children's education., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 'By 2025, girls and boys in Ethiopia, in particular the most disadvantaged and those affected by humanitarian situations, benefit from an equitable and resilient education system enabling them to acquire relevant knowledge and skills.

participating-org.narrative: B GUMUZ REGIONAL EDUCATION BUREAU REB

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF House (Kazanchis - Opposite UNECA/German House) P.O. Box 1169 Addis Ababa

sector.narrative: System strengthening - Evidence based education sector planning
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, capacity of the Ethiopian General Education System strengthened in evidence-based, equity-focused and decentralized sectorplanning, policy implementation and monitoring results for children?s education.

description.narrative: The offical launching of the Education Sector Development Proramme (ESDP VI) and its handover to the Regional Education Bureaus, the preparation and development of its subsequent results framework by some regions and the finalization of the 2020/21 EMIS data collection and national level compilation were major achievements of the result area. The finalization of the out-of-of-school children study and the major findings, key recommendations and its associated costed strategy were found to be useful for evidence-based advocacy and strategy development which will faciliate the achivements of results under the education flagship. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:08/01/2022

title.narrative: Indicator 4.1: ESDP VI and associated Results Framework developed and implemented for operational planning and M&E at federal and regional levels, with UNICEF support(70240)
